history.content:
As a disclaimer: what is most directly applicable is almost certainly dependent on the place you end up working for.

I interned for Western Digital as a PM over last summer, and I found that CS 161 (Security) and Econ 140 (Econometrics) helped me understand some of the choices made / needing to be made.

children.subject:
i interned as a PM this past summer and worked with APIs & microservices and there wasn't really one class that helped me. In general, having a technical background will help but in most cases it's not required. Just take classes that interest you vs. classes that you think you need for PM, since more likely than not unless you're in a specific industry working on a specific product, you're not going to be using technical concepts straight from these classes.

The required CS classes (61 series), Data 100, CS 160/161/168/186 come to mind as classes that will develop this technical background while others like 162, 170, are probably more useful for SWE.

history.content: To anyone who has interned/worked in product management, what CS/non-CS classes have you found most directly applicable to your work? Thank you!
history.subject: CS courses useful to PM
